tn.text: "Listen to my message." Yahweh is speaking.
Here "house" refers to the descendants of Jacob. AT: "descendants of Jacob" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: who are called by the name Israel
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom everyone calls the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: have come from the sperm of Judah
tn.text: This phrase emphasizes that they are the direct, physical descendants of Judah. AT: "are the descendants of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"call on the God of Israel"
This refers to the people of Israel. AT: "you call yourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
This refers to Jerusalem.
Translate this phrase the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:01:09|1:9]].
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: they came out from my mouth
tn.text: "Mouth" refers to someone speaking. AT: "I spoke these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: your neck muscles tight as iron, and your forehead like bronze
tn.text: Yahweh compares the tightness of their neck muscles and the hardness of their foreheads to the hardness of iron and bronze. Here, to have a tight neck or a hard forehead is a metaphor that means the people are stubborn. AT: "it is as if your necks were iron and your heads were bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I declared these things to you beforehand; before they happened I informed you
tn.text: This is saying the same thing twice for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: will you not admit what I said is true?
tn.text: Yahweh uses a question to scold the people of Israel for not admitting what they should know is true. AT: "you are stubborn and will not admit what I said is true." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: these things were not unfolded to your ears beforehand
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of explaining something as if it were unfolding it. The word "ears" represents the people who are listening. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I did not explain these things to you beforehand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]],  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]], and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh speaks of the nation's beginning as if it were its birth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: For the sake of my name I will defer my anger
tn.text: Here the word "name" refers to Yahweh's reputation. AT: "For the sake of my reputation I will delay my anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: and for my honor I will hold back from destroying you
tn.text: This part of the sentence means basically the same thing as the first part. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Look, I refined you, but not as silver; I have purified you in the furnace of affliction
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of using affliction to purify his people as if they were precious metals and affliction were a furnace in which he refines them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: for how can I allow my name to be dishonored?
tn.text: Yahweh uses a question to emphasize that he can never allow his own name to be dishonored. This can be stated in active form. AT: "for I cannot allow anyone to dishonor my name." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.
Both of these refer to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I am the first, I also am the last
tn.text: This phrase emphasizes Yahweh's eternal nature. Possible meanings are 1) "I am the one who began all things, and I am the one who ends all things" or 2) "I am the one who has always lived, and I am the one who always will live." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:44:06|44:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: my hand laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand spread out the heavens
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to Yahweh. AT: "I laid the foundation of the earth, and I spread out the heavens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

The word "foundation" normally refers to a stone structure that gives support to a building from underneath. Here it describes a similar structure that was thought to support and hold the earth in place. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:24:17|24:18]].

Yahweh speaks of creating the heavens as if they were fabric which Yahweh stretched out. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:42:05|42:5]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: when I call to them, they stand up together
tn.text: Standing up when Yahweh calls is a metaphor for being ready to obey him. Yahweh speaks of the earth and the heavens as if they were able to hear him and obey him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Possible meanings are 1) "when I call the earth and the heavens" or 2) "when I call the stars in the heavens."
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Who among you has announced these things?
tn.text: Yahweh uses a question to emphasize that the idols have not told them these things. AT: "None of your idols has told this to you." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Yahweh's ally will accomplish his purpose against Babylon. He will carry out Yahweh's will against the Chaldeans
tn.text: Here "ally" refers to Cyrus. Both of these sentences mean the same thing and are used for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"Yahweh's purpose"
The word "I" is repeated for emphasis. AT: "I myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: I have not spoken in secret
tn.text: This can be expressed positively. AT: "I have spoken plainly and clearly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Here "me" refers to an unknown servant of Yahweh, maybe Isaiah or Cyrus or the promised Messiah.
Here "your" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_youdual]])
Translate this word in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:41:14|41:14]].
Translate this phrase in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:01:04|1:4]].

tn.ref: who leads you by the way that you should go
tn.text: Yahweh teaching the people how they should live is spoken of as if he were leading them to walk on the correct paths. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: If only you had obeyed my commandments
tn.text: Yahweh describes something that could have happened but did not. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: Then your peace and prosperity would have flowed like a river, and your salvation like the waves of the sea
tn.text: These two phrases share similar meanings. In both, Yahweh speaks of Israel's experiencing abundant blessings as if those blessings flowed like water. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: your salvation like the waves of the sea
tn.text: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "your salvation would have flowed like the waves of the sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Yahweh continues describing a hypothetical situation to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Your descendants would have been as numerous as the sand, and the children from your womb as numerous as the grains of sand
tn.text: These both mean that the people would have had more descendants than they could count. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh speaks of the descendants of the people of Israel as if they were children to which the nation gives birth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: their name would not have been cut off nor blotted out
tn.text: The people of Israel being destroyed is spoken of as if their name had been cut off, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree, or blotted out. This can be translated in active form. AT: "I would not have cut off nor blotted out their name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here the word "name" refers to the descendants who would carry on the name of Israel. AT: "they" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These two expressions in this context refer to destroying the people. AT: "destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: to the ends of the earth
tn.text: The places on the earth that are very far away are spoken of as if they were the places where the earth ends. This phrase also forms a merism and refers to everywhere in between the ends. AT: "to all the farthest places of the earth" or "to the entire earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This refers to the descendants of Jacob. AT: "the people of Israel, his servants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: They did not thirst ... the waters gushed out
tn.text: This refers to an event in the history of the people of Israel when Yahweh took care of them while they lived in the desert after escaping Egypt.
